Summary: Everyone, before the meeting, found a potential customer with an app idea
Design Decisions: Choose customer who wants a health-tracking application
Rationale for Design Decisions: The other ideas seemed too difficult, given our experience

Summary: Discussed customers interviewed and their app ideas
Design Decisions: Don't go with app about encrypting (texts, emails, images)
Rationale for Design Decisions: The other ideas seemed to rely/need some sort of network integration, which we could not incoporate

Summary: Decided on which app to pursue
Design Decisions: Don't go with app about video+subtitling
Don’t' go with app about graphing generic data (but incorporate it into health-tracking)
Don't go with app that detects collisions in real life
Don’t go with app that tracks business inquiries
Don't go with tinder clone app for couches

Summary: Discussed health tracking app, gave it a name
Design Decisions: Named app HealthTrack
Rationale for Design Decisions: WhatsApp group chat to coordinate meetings/informal discussions

Summary: Discussed ideas about coordinating and organizing work
Design Decisions: Use WhatsApp
Rationale for Design Decisions: Trello gave us an interface that looked like the Roadmap slide shown in class

Summary: Discussed ideas about maintaining consistency in coding styles
Design Decisions: Use Trello
Rationale for Design Decisions: Slack allows organized discussion about features as they can be subdivided into categories

Design Decisions: Use Slack
Rationale for Design Decisions: Slack allows us to see/be notified of commits and comment on them

Design Decisions: Scott will make the GitHub repo
Rationale for Design Decisions: Shared Google Drive folder allows coordinating files that are relevant to project but not part of the app (eg meetings files)

Design Decisions: Check shared Drive folder/Trello for coding standards file
Rationale for Design Decisions: The graphing would require lots of work so we should start that first (algorithms to generate the graphics/graphs)

Design Decisions: Integrate graphing/pie charts/statistical analysis into app
Rationale for Design Decisions: Scott has a private GitHub repo we can use for this project, as we did not want the project available publicly (yet?)

Design Decisions: Allow customers to input data
Rationale for Design Decisions: Everyone should use JavaDocs when possible

Design Decisions: Allow customers to input most eaten foods
Rationale for Design Decisions: Everyone should include 4 files: the class, a version control/log file, test files, JavaDocs auto-generated HTML)

Summary: Planned date for formal meeting with customer
Design Decisions: Customer has inconvenient meeting hours
Rationale for Design Decisions: Everyone except Scott is busy during the hours the customer is available

Summary: Recording equipment available through Scott
Design Decisions: Scott will meet the customer and record the video himself
Rationale for Design Decisions: The customer cannot come to the university and arranging for rides to get to a place they can meet was daunting
Spoke with professor and found that not everyone has to be present for the recording
We thought up questions to ask the customer that Scott would ask and record the answers of

Summary: Brought individual vision statements together
Design Decisions: Features:
Rationale for Design Decisions: The goals setting and flexibility would only require a few database calls and organization

Summary: Combined into one vision statement
Design Decisions: Goal settings + flexibilty
Rationale for Design Decisions: The customer should be able to input their own food + have a preloaded list to choose from. Two tables to maintain consistency and defaults

Summary: Broke down video into (big/) user stories
Design Decisions: Custom foods + pre-loaded foods from an existing database
Rationale for Design Decisions: The notifications will be used to tell the user of goal related information or warnings

Summary: Decided on which elements to not pursue
Design Decisions: Push Notifications for user reminders
Rationale for Design Decisions: The foods should not be static images or information but interactable to allow user friendliness

Summary: Estimated times of completion for each user story
Design Decisions: Breakdown of foods for health content

Summary: Prepped submission for Jan25,2016
Discussed app design (GUI made)
Design Decisions: Color scheme should be brighter
Rationale for Design Decisions: Brighter colors will make the app more vibrant

Summary: Compiled ideas/resources for understanding Android development
Design Decisions: We will be using a library to generate the Pie charts and graphs
Rationale for Design Decisions: We are allowed to use third party libraries (after speaking to professor)

Summary: Review Google's android tutorials
Rationale for Design Decisions: The third party libraries save days on the statistical information display user story

Summary: Discussed Chart Library use
Discussed GUI colour and refactoring
Design Decisions: We decided to use peach colours
Rationale for Design Decisions: Background was unusable on larger devices

Summary: Added Canadian Nutrition File (CNF)
Design Decisions: Added the CNF files to the Android file
Rationale for Design Decisions: The CNF files have nutritional information and we can easily extract whatever rows we need/want

Summary: Updated hours of user stories
Design Decisions: We will research standard Android GUIs
Rationale for Design Decisions: Android has standard features so that we don't have to spend time "reinventing the wheel"

Summary: Prepped submission of Itr1
Design Decisions: We have to put more emphasis on coding standards
Rationale for Design Decisions: Emphasizing coding standards will make it easier to understand each other's code

Summary: Re-estimated times of completion for each user story
Design Decisions: Reduced estimates
Rationale for Design Decisions: Estimates were inflated as per Itr0 grading, and needed to be re-evaluated

Summary: Updated the priority of Statistical Feature
Design Decisions: Made Statistical Features a High Priority
Rationale for Design Decisions: We felt this was a feature that made the app stand out the most as visually representing the numbers generated by this app will be its selling point
